data.title: Disable music autoplay if there are insufficient installed tracks.
data.body:
If the player has less than two regular tracks available (ignoring shellmap and score tracks, which are going to be hidden from the player) then we should not autoplay them during regular games.  This will avoid the issue where we loop hell march continuously in RA.

I'm sure we used to do this in the past, but it must have been lost in one of the refactors.

data.title: Distinguish between 'ambient' and regular music
data.body:
There are still a few cases that are poorly handled by our music playlist code because we are trying to apply a one-size-fits-all approach to two different use cases.

Consider the shellmap as an example: main menu music is a standard feature across almost all games, and is usually a low-key ambient music loop.  In our current implementation we treat the shellmap music as a regular track and (based on user preferences) cycle between all the available songs or stop playing anything after the song has completed its first playthrough.  Even worse, if the player has the default RA content download (which only includes one track) then the main menu will loop Hell March - one of our least low-key ambient tracks!  We have similar problems with the Ion Storm ambient track in TS, and the end-game victory/loss tracks.

A simple (and I believe the best) way to handle these cases is to introduce an `AmbientMusic` property on the `MusicPlaylist` trait.  If this is set, then it is looped (ignoring any player music preferences) as the default music choice.  If the file is defined but not present (music content not installed) then it should play nothing instead of selecting an alternative track.  Player selected music (and the InitialMusic trait property) take precident over the ambient music, but the ambient track should start again as soon as the regular playlist runs out of songs or is manually stopped in the music player.

Ambient tracks should also be displayed slightly different in the music player: they show the name and progress in the bottom player, but the playback controls (play/pause/next/prev) should be disabled.

data.title: Show an indicator when server is not responding
data.body:
When server is not responding, lobby state is frozen without any indication. You can't click ready for example. But you can send chat messages even though the server is not receiving them. So I think a message or an indicator should be shown when there is no continuous connection to server. Otherwise messages you send are lost. And it would be even better if chat field and player field were disabled so you can't use them if there is no connection.

Crash when your spies coppy your tranya

If you are using a spy to clone a tanya and try to move your tanya-spy the game frezzes. I noticed it and was able to reproduced it at my weather overlay branche.

Can somebody reproduce it?

data.title: Implement interface members explicitly.
data.body:
This would remove the temptation to call interface members from unrelated code, and would make implementations a bit more clear when methods and/or fields have vague names.

Input / opinions?

data.title: InfiltrateForPlayerUpgrades
data.body:
Add InfiltrateForPlayerUpgrades so the infiltrating player can unlock tech, or do anything else upgrade-related.

Will be used in RA2.

data.title: Fix quick ReloadTimeMultiplier => ReloadDelayMultiplier rename
data.body: I made the rename after a comment and forgot both one spot in the upgrade rules and to re-test.

data.title: AI Destroys Oil Derricks
data.body:
While testing, I noticed the Naval AI target and destroy the oil derricks before focusing on its enemy.
Unlike #4561, this is about attacking them instead. This might be fixable by changing the faction of the oil derricks. I noticed this on Artic Triangle Affair map where the oil derricks are on islands not between the two bases.

data.title: Minor pathfinder-related changes (preparation for mobile refactor)
data.body: This is a bunch of presumably "safe", easy to review changes from #7565.

data.title: Hide the songs which were hidden in the base games.
Restore the original setup of the menu music in the RA mod.
Unhardcode some things in Bullet.
Simplifies Start button logic in lobby
data.body: This does the same thing but is simpler.

data.title: Too many range circles
data.body:
I was placing a turret and this happened:
![rangecircles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/8733094/70e594ac-2c0a-11e5-9dd5-acb0a3719274.png)

I think only range circles of the same type should be shown. No con yard circles while placing turret for example. Also, enemy circles are also shown here...

data.title: Reduce allocations
data.body:
A set of changes that avoid allocating memory where it can be avoided during the main game loop to reduce GC pressure. However I have attempted to avoid making any "clever" changes.

See individual commits for details - these changes combined save ~16% in memory allocations in the main game loop (if you have something with a circle range highlight selected).

data.title: Replaced RenderGunboat with WithGunboatBody
data.body:
For consistency with other actor render traits.

Note: I'm aware that this is slightly hacky, but I've already spent far too much time on this special case that will likely never be used for anything but the TD gunboat, so unless someone can give me a quick and easy solution to get rid of the work-arounds, I don't intend to make any more time-consuming changes.

data.title: TargetTypes by Upgrade and Replacement of Targetable* by Targetable and ITargetablePositions
data.body: Closes #8724, unless there is something else to it.

data.title: Restore the original setup of the menu and score musics in the D2k mod.
data.body: http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2015&month=07&day=15#22:36:47

data.title: Step towards removing RenderSimple and its derivatives (Part 1)
data.body: This PR gets some of the easy stuff out of the way to reduce the diff and improve reviewability of the follow-ups.

data.title: Proposal to refactor TargetType handling
data.body:
Currently we have like 4-5 traits which handle TargetTypes on actors.
TargetableBuilding returns the cells
TargetableUnit works on units
and multiple subclasses of TargetableUnit, all working around the fact that an actor can have only one Targetable\* trait.

I honestly didn't really looked into the code much, but from what I saw, merging TargetableBuilding and TargetableUnit is possible (via moving the Building() check in the latter) and then instead of having TargetableAircraft etc, we could set up their source traits granting an upgrade to enable/disable targeting/affection. (Helicopter granting an upgrade at height 200 for example)

This will be important for the RA2 mod because at there unit-targeting could change on the fly (Temporal weapons made the target only affected by such, an already mindcontrolled unit cannot be remindcontrolled, IronCurtained units weren't attacked by the AI, units in-air (paradropped or flying) couldn't get targeted by strictly ground weapons, etc).

This would also render map scripting easier.

data.title: Unselect badly damaged units / no ammo
data.body:
I thought it might be an idea that when a group of units is selected to have a key to unselect units in red health. Similarly a key to unselect units with low ammo. Maybe even unit types? This could make microing air units much easier.
